reviews.review: Always great movie as Disney production
It was as wonderful as the first one!!  I highly, highly recommend it.

I loved the movie. The theatre for the price did not have reclining seats which was disappointing. And my wine cup that was not inexpensive either spilled because there was not a tray to place the drink. Only a cup holder that didn't fit the small plastic cup. The move was fantastic. Next time I will look at the details to ensure they are reclining seats.

Even better than the first Frozen. The story is more developed and complex, the animation has ramped up to an amazing level. The theme song is unlikely to be the extraordinary hit that Let It Go was, but the album is a sure winner. Enjoy!
I enjoyed this cinematic piece more than the first. It is filled with mystery, new characters, and a wonderful disney ending. I would recommend to all ages!

And the movie was so awesome and not 5 stars more than a trillion stars i can give that much super this movie i can't tell this in my words and i am 13 years boy 8th class .

*Spoilers*

Surprisingly the movie does not seem to rely too heavily on redundant plot lines like most sequals do. With that said, the beginning doesn't flow as well as the prior -- all of a sudden Elsa 'wakes up' the forest, and very rapidly she, Anna, Kristoff, etc are on an adventure, leaving the townspeople in the capable hands of the trolls? It was noticibly forced. I do think it was probably a good choice to move through this part quickly given that the interesting parts of the story occur outside of Arendelle, but it just felt a little nonsensical.

Also, Anna and Kristoff's relationship was cute, but sadly reduced to Kristoff trying to ask her to marry him (and failing) throughout the whole movie. Just as Anna's role shouldn't be reduced to her love life (and isn't), Kristoff's role shouldn't be either. It was nice to see him be somewhat useful at the end, but overall rather disappointing. 

And Kristoff's power ballad?? Why?
Amazing!!! I want to see it again!!!!
Great production. The new songs are not as catchy as the first one.
Tells the history of why Else has her magical powers.  Also, shows Anna coming into her own and developing the personal strength to lead on her own.
